result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott Anthony Jatczak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: DOC Balance Inquiry
Order to pay $220 restitution
order to disburse
Assessment report
Four letters of support submitted by Attorney Griggs
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 2:54 pm [Case was scheduled for STC]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Scott Anthony Jatczak in court with Attorney Andrew R. Griggs. ADA Jeffrey M. Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Griggs submits plea paperwork and letc. in support of Def. 
On Motion of the State, the Court strikes the domestic abuse repeater enhancer on each count

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Counts #1 & #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
ADA Shock submits victim impact statement

On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant to serve 90 days jail - this sentence is IMPOSED AND STAYED and the Court places Mr. Jatczak on probation for 2 years, concurrent, with conditions: 

On Count #2, the Court sentences the Defendant to serve 30 days jail, consecutive to Count #1 - this sentence is IMPOSED AND STAYED and the Court places Mr. Jatczak on probation for 2 years, concurrent, with conditions: 

Conditions for Counts #1 & #2:
--Continue compliance and follow-through with Cornerstone Counseling Treatment Program
--To pay restitution of $220 payable to Suzanne Carlson
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--No acts/threats of violence 
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To pay costs of $486 ($243 each count)
--To pay $400 DNA Surcharge ($200 each count)
--To pay $200 Domestic Abuse Surcharge ($100 each count)
APPLY CASH BOND

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Recess: 3:22 pm
Status conference on April 10, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 2:28 pm 
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Scott Anthony Jatczak in court with Attorney Andrew R Griggs. ADA Monica J Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Griggs: Continuing negotiations, close to agreement, one issue to work out yet - requests matter be set for FSSC in April
ADA Hall: Suggests matter be set for additional STC rather than FSSC
Court confirms address on file is accurate

NEXT:  Schedule STC 4/10/14 at 2:30 pm - Send notices
State's (with cover letter)
Status conference on February 21, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on February 5, 2014 at 09:40 am.
Scheduling notice

ADDRESS INFO for Scott Anthony Jatczak
Current: 114 Fremont St, Watertown, WI 53094   (Effective: 01-09-2014)
Prior: 114 Fremont St, Watertown, WI 53098

Case called at 10:16 am
Defendant Scott Anthony Jatczak in court with Attorney Nicole Schrier on behalf of Attorney Griggs. ADA John E Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court has reviewed the criminal complaint and found that it states probable cause to support Counts #
Attorney Schier informs the Court that the victim listed in the criminal complaint Suzanne L. Carlson, should be Suzanne I. Carlson.
ADA Fryatt motions the Court to modify the criminal complaint to show Suzanne I. Carlson.
No objection from Attorney Schrier.
Court by it's own hand corrects the scribboners error.
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court continues the $150.00 CASH bond, with additional non-monetary conditions:
-No acts or threats of violence towards anyone
-No contact with Suzanne I. Carlson 

recess: 10:24 am
